item.title: sendMessage x2
item.dc:creator: @MMcgrady1 MMcgrady1
item.description:
@MMcgrady1 wrote:

[quote=“Fir3 Flam3, post:14, topic:120391”]Right… that’s still a messy way of doing things.

LeScape PK, making the 0 + won’t make it splash, and it won’t make it hit 0 either. That’s making it do nothing plus 26, which is 26. It can still hit 0 without having the 0 +. Don’t say it doesn’t because it does on my server.

Okay, keep a shitty looking Ice Barrage.[/quote]I DO NOT WANT YOUR CODE, YOUR’S IS GAY!

item.title: sendMessage x2
item.dc:creator: @Fir3_Flam3 Fir3 Flam3
item.description:
@Fir3_Flam3 wrote:

Right… that’s still a messy way of doing things.

LeScape PK, making the 0 + won’t make it splash, and it won’t make it hit 0 either. That’s making it do nothing plus 26, which is 26. It can still hit 0 without having the 0 +. Don’t say it doesn’t because it does on my server.

Okay, keep a shitty looking Ice Barrage.

item.title: sendMessage x2
item.dc:creator: @MMcgrady1 MMcgrady1
item.description:
@MMcgrady1 wrote:

[quote=“MMcgrady1, post:4, topic:120391”]Nevermind, I figured it out. I now have this:

if(magicID == 12891) {// Ice Barrage if(playerLevel[6] >= 93) { if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2)==false)|| (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6) == true)) { stillgfx(369, EnemyY2, EnemyX2); stillgfx(368, absY, absX); hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(26); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; addSkillXP((100*hitDiff), playerMagic); setAnimation(1979); deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 4); deleteItem(565, getItemSlot(565), 2); deleteItem(555, getItemSlot(555), 6); } else { sendMessage("You need 94 magic to cast this spell!"); } } }
I forgot to add the else, it was reading it as if I don’t have runes, go all the way down to } else {, but I added an else up top so that if you didn’t have runes, it would go to the closest } else { :D.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: sendMessage x2
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

  1. you have it requiring 93 magic
>= 93
  1. its because you have
if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2)==false)|| (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==false))

and then a

} else {

} else { means that if ANY of the if statements are not correct, it will happen, and your magic level message was under else, make it

} else if (playerLevel[6] <= 93) {
sendMessage("You need a magic level of 94 to cast this spell.");
}

Read full topic

item.title: sendMessage x2
item.dc:creator: @MMcgrady1 MMcgrady1
item.description:
@MMcgrady1 wrote:

[quote=“Fir3 Flam3, post:5, topic:120391”]This one is alot more organised IMO, and I’ve fixed alot of things in it.

if(magicID == 12891) //Ice Barrage { if(playerLevel[6] >= 94) { if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)) || (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2))|| (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6))) { stillgfx(369, EnemyY2, EnemyX2); stillgfx(368, absY, absX); hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(26); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; addSkillXP((100*hitDiff), playerMagic); setAnimation(1979); deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 4); deleteItem(565, getItemSlot(565), 2); deleteItem(555, getItemSlot(555), 6); } else if((!playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)) || (!playerHasItemAmount(565, 2))|| (!playerHasItemAmount(555, 6))) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 93) { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 94 to cast this spell."); } } }

Then also paste that over your Ice Barrage’s Spell ID :)[/quote]No thank you, I’d rather learn mine, than copy and paste.

Read full topic

i think you forgot

item.title: sendMessage x2
item.dc:creator: @Fir3_Flam3 Fir3 Flam3
item.description:
@Fir3_Flam3 wrote:

This one is alot more organised IMO, and I’ve fixed alot of things in it.

if(magicID == 12891) //Ice Barrage { if(playerLevel[6] >= 94) { if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)) || (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2)) || (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6))) { stillgfx(369, EnemyY2, EnemyX2); stillgfx(368, absY, absX); hitDiff = misc.random(26); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; addSkillXP((100*hitDiff), playerMagic); setAnimation(1979); deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 4); deleteItem(565, getItemSlot(565), 2); deleteItem(555, getItemSlot(555), 6); } else if((!playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)) || (!playerHasItemAmount(565, 2))|| (!playerHasItemAmount(555, 6))) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 93) { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 94 to cast this spell."); } } }

Then also paste that over your Ice Barrage’s Spell ID

You don’t need the 0 + misc.random part, and also instead of using true or false to see if you have the correct runes, just prefix it with an exclamation mark. I think Aftermath made a thread in Tut Section about it.

Read full topic

item.title: sendMessage x2
item.dc:creator: @MMcgrady1 MMcgrady1
item.description:
@MMcgrady1 wrote:

Nevermind, I figured it out. I now have this:

if(magicID == 12891) {// Ice Barrage if(playerLevel[6] >= 93) { if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2)==false)|| (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6) == true)) { stillgfx(369, EnemyY2, EnemyX2); stillgfx(368, absY, absX); hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(26); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; addSkillXP((100*hitDiff), playerMagic); setAnimation(1979); deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 4); deleteItem(565, getItemSlot(565), 2); deleteItem(555, getItemSlot(555), 6); } else { sendMessage("You need 94 magic to cast this spell!"); } } }
I forgot to add the else, it was reading it as if I don’t have runes, go all the way down to } else {, but I added an else up top so that if you didn’t have runes, it would go to the closest } else { :D.

Read full topic

item.title: sendMessage x2
item.dc:creator: @MMcgrady1 MMcgrady1
item.description:
@MMcgrady1 wrote:

Recently, I have made ice barrage require 94 magic and the correct runes:

if(magicID == 12891) {// Ice Barrage if(playerLevel[6] >= 93) { if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2)==false)|| (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6) == true)) { stillgfx(369, EnemyY2, EnemyX2); stillgfx(368, absY, absX); hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(26); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; addSkillXP((100*hitDiff), playerMagic); setAnimation(1979); deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 4); deleteItem(565, getItemSlot(565), 2); deleteItem(555, getItemSlot(555), 6); } else { sendMessage("You need 94 magic to cast this spell!"); } } }
If I do not have the correct runes, I get a message saying I do not have the runes AND I don’t have the correct magic level, but I do have the correct magic level. Why does it send the message when I have the right magic level?

Read full topic
